Uses of Interface
org.actioncontroller.ApiHttpExchange

  • Packages that use ApiHttpExchange 
    Package Description
    org.actioncontroller
    Action Controller is a framework that takes "controller" classes and generates ApiControllerAction for each method annotated with a "routing mapper annotation" such as GET.
    org.actioncontroller.exceptions  
    org.actioncontroller.httpserver  
    org.actioncontroller.jakarta  
    org.actioncontroller.meta
    The meta-package contains annotations used on other annotations to attach behavior to the annotations.
    org.actioncontroller.servlet  
    org.actioncontroller.values  
    org.actioncontroller.values.json

      void ApiControllerAction.invoke​(UserContext userContext, ApiHttpExchange exchange)
      Invokes this action on the given ApiHttpExchange by converting the exchange to method invocation arguments, invoking the method and converting the return value.
      void ApiControllerMethodAction.invoke​(UserContext userContext, ApiHttpExchange exchange)

      boolean UserContext.isUserLoggedIn​(ApiHttpExchange exchange)  
      boolean ApiControllerAction.matchesRequiredParameters​(ApiHttpExchange exchange)
      Returns true if the exchange has all the required query parameters specified in this action, or if there are no required query parameters in the action
